hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Masud: Whoever intends to commit a sin but does not act upon it, it will not be written against him until he commits it. And if a man intends while he is able to kill a man near the House (of Allah), Allah would make him taste a painful punishment. Then he recited: And whoever intends therein to do wrong (i.e., to enter the Haram for some unlawful purpose) by violence, We shall cause him to taste of a painful punishment (Quran 22:25).
